alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Buckeye, Avondale; Northwest Valley; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:11AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 615 AM MST... At 511 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Buckeye, moving west at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Surprise, Buckeye, Tonopah, Palo Verde, Perryville, White Tank Mountain Park, Liberty, Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station, Wintersburg, Hassayampa and Arlington. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 93 and 121. AZ Route 85 between mile markers 143 and 154. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Aguila Valley; Buckeye, Avondale; Northwest Valley; Tonopah Desert
